page.title: 05Valley Farm
page.content: The farm has existed since the{17th century.Since{1945 Valley Farm}has been owned by the second{Baron {Hollenden}and his wife{Anne. The family house has been added to in recent years by the architect{Louis {Osman.}The house has a spectacular fireplace, a green oak staircase and peacocks in the garden. Mixed farming is carried out on a small scale,the main concern now,being forestry.There are 85{Exmoor-horn sheep,1{Guernsey cow and bullock;}the sheep give Grade{A}wool. The farm covers{100}acres,half of which is given to animals and the rest to forestry.It has its own water supply from a line of{pure}springs.It is worked by only{two} men. Rabbits,deer,squirrels and pigeons are a nuisance.
